components/esm/loadscpt.hpp

00001 #ifndef _ESM_SCPT_H
00002 #define _ESM_SCPT_H
00003 
00004 #include "esm_reader.hpp"
00005 
00006 namespace ESM {
00007 
00008 /*
00009  * Script definitions
00010  */
00011 
00012 class Script
00013 {
00014 public:
00015   struct SCHDstruct
00016   {
00017     /* Script name.
00018 
00019        NOTE: You should handle the name "Main" (case insensitive) with
00020        care. With tribunal, modders got the ability to add 'start
00021        scripts' to their mods, which is a script that is run at
00022        startup and which runs throughout the game (I think.)
00023 
00024        However, before Tribunal, there was only one startup script,
00025        called "Main". If mods wanted to make their own start scripts,
00026        they had to overwrite Main. This is obviously problem if
00027        multiple mods to this at the same time.
00028 
00029        Although most mods have switched to using Trib-style startup
00030        scripts, some legacy mods might still overwrite Main, and this
00031        can cause problems if several mods do it. I think the best
00032        course of action is to NEVER overwrite main, but instead add
00033        each with a separate unique name and add them to the start
00034        script list. But there might be other problems with this
00035        approach though.
00036       */
00037 
00038     NAME32 name;
00039 
00040     // These describe the sizes we need to allocate for the script
00041     // data.
00042     int numShorts, numLongs, numFloats,
00043       scriptDataSize, stringTableSize;
00044   }; // 52 bytes
00045 
00046   SCHDstruct data;
00047 
00048   std::vector<std::string> varNames; // Variable names
00049   std::vector<char> scriptData; // Compiled bytecode
00050   std::string scriptText; // Uncompiled script
00051 
00052   void load(ESMReader &esm)
00053   {
00054     esm.getHNT(data, "SCHD", 52);
00055 
00056     // List of local variables
00057     if(esm.isNextSub("SCVR"))
00058       {
00059         int s = data.stringTableSize;
00060         char* tmp = new char[s];
00061         esm.getHExact(tmp, s);
00062 
00063         // Set up the list of variable names
00064         varNames.resize(data.numShorts +
00065                         data.numLongs +
00066                         data.numFloats);
00067 
00068         // The tmp buffer is a null-byte separated string list, we
00069         // just have to pick out one string at a time.
00070         char* str = tmp;
00071         for(size_t i=0; i< varNames.size(); i++)
00072           {
00073             varNames[i] = std::string(str);
00074             str += varNames[i].size()+1;
00075 
00076             if(str - tmp > s)
00077               esm.fail("String table overflow");
00078           }
00079         delete[] tmp;
00080       }
00081 
00082     // Script data
00083     scriptData.resize(data.scriptDataSize);
00084     esm.getHNExact(&scriptData[0], scriptData.size(), "SCDT");
00085 
00086     // Script text
00087     scriptText = esm.getHNOString("SCTX");
00088   }
00089 };
00090 }
00091 #endif
